line_1: Oh do not then, my lovely Swain, accuse
line_2: My Want of Truth, nor charge on me thy Woes:
At Night the melancholly Strain renews;

line_1: Nature's faint Progress in the Work accuse,
line_2: Till rip'ning Hours the vig'rous Life infuse.

line_1: Which of hid Treasons does his Fame accuse.
line_2: As boldly He the dangerous Paper views,

line_1: But lest, my Lord, your Patience should accuse
line_2: The dull Narration of a tedious Muse,

line_1: Absolve with Coldness, or with Spight accuse:
line_2: Let ev'ry Tongue it's various Censures chuse,

line_1: For well she knows, your froward sense accuse:
line_2: O let a rural conscious Muse,

line_1: Me, my Florella! Me, dost thou accuse!
line_2: Or tax with perjur'd Love, or broken Vows!

line_1: LET not the rugged brow the rhymes accuse,
line_2: Nor scorn the lighter labours of the muse,
